subject: Re: Reminder: Order #SSN1543, how did it go?
description_text:
Cheers, still stuck in Sydney at the moment, 4 business days there, hopefully it arrives next week

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
From: SIMSONN <no-reply@loox.io>
Sent: Thursday, July 3, 2025 2:14:37 PM
To: wayneshephard72@gmail.com <wayneshephard72@gmail.com>
Subject: Reminder: Order #SSN1543, how did it go?

Hello Wayne, We would be grateful if you shared how things look and feel. Your review helps us and the community that supports us, and it only takes a few seconds. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
[https://loox.io/img/emails/banners/review-request-banner.png?default]
Hello Wayne,

We would be grateful if you shared how things look and feel. Your review helps us and the community that supports us, and it only takes a few seconds.
[Simsonn VAM Pedals Haptic Reactor the Rumble Motor for Linear Vibration Feedback]
Simsonn VAM Pedals Haptic Reactor the Rumble Motor for Linear Vibration Feedback
Plus X Pedal Control Box

conversations.body_text:
Hi folks, not having much joy here with my delivery, tracking seems to have stalled for over a week now.
It's not urgent ofcourse but not much chance of seeing it any time soon.

Not sure why it's held up.

Kind regards,
Wayne

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________

Hi folks, just an update, the parcel has arrived, the freight company here are moving location and tracking is not updating, turns out it is supposed to have arrived today. I'm 300 kilometres away but it says it's arrived.
Cheers,
Wayne

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________

Hi Wayne Shephard,  Do you mean the parcel has not yet been delivered to show the signature, for this situation logistics company is how to explain to you, did they say when they can be delivered for you? If there is a problem please feedback with us in time, please don't worry.

All good, it's been delivered now, not sure what happened but it was such in Sydney for ages.
Fantastic looking gear Thankyou, I'll install it over the weekend and report how good they are.

Ask the best,
Wayne

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
Hi Wayne Shephard,    Thanks for the prompt feedback and have fun!

Hi folks, I've been running the haptics on Simhub, I do really want to try your software though, the path to iracing is requested in the software and I've tried using the iracing launcher, the telemetry folder and the UI for the path but it doesn't like any of those.
Can you recommend what particular file it is searching for?
I'd like to use your software if I can as I currently have no real need for Simhub, even though it is awesome software, I'm just not requiring it at present.
I initially could not get Simsonn Manager to recognise the hardware, it was strange, but upon a couple of windows reboots and trying another usb port it is going well now, so the vibration test works, I just need to get it talking to iracing now.
Lovely hardware you have created, I'm very impressed.

Kind regards,
Wayne Shephard
________________________________

I'm not sure why you're asking me for my thoughts on this equipment, I've
been trying to get your software working for a week now and it won't
configure properly in Simsonn Manager, I am trying to get telemetry from
iracing for the haptics so Simsonn Manager can drive them and it will not
work, no instructions anywhere, nobody seems to know, yes, I can use Simhub
but i want to use the software designed for the Haptics, I mostly don't use
Simhub with iRacing.
Surely you have an idea how to make this work?
At this point I'm unimpressed with the way they work in Simhub and assume
they will be much better with your software but the lack of guides,
support, responses to emails is making it a bit of a non starter for me.
If they don't work with your software then they really aren't much good to
me.
I'm hopeful this is an easy fix but without your help I'm in the dark.

Kind regards,
Wayne Shephard
Hi Wayne Shephard,  Which racing games do you mainly play? We’ll be releasing version 2.0.9 soon, which will support the following games:

I have clearly mentioned iracing twice in this email and Walsh before many times, is the only sim I am intending to use the for.
Really keen to use your software but no matter what path to iracing I try in your software, it never seems to activate the haptics. They work on the vibration test button but nothing more.

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
Hi Wayne Shephard, This is SIMSONN Manager 2.0.9. You can download it and test to see if everything works correctly.           https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bLzY53f09S4V74qW5p_Ly6drplTrxUDt/view

I'll try it, Thankyou, in regards to my original question, in your software the path to iracing haptic data is requested, exactly what destination is the software asking for? The iracing 64launcher? Or the UI.exe? I have tried several options with no response and no relevant instructions seen to be available, I've not seen anyone report this software as working with iracing.
I'll try this new version,  but assume this step still needs to be completed.

Kind regards,
Wayne

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________

Hi Wayne Shephard,    There’s no need to manually set the iRacing path — the software will automatically detect it.  In version 2.0.9, you can simply click the iRacing icon to launch directly, with no path configuration required.  Additionally, version 2.0.9 supports automatic update detection and upgrade from the settings page in older versions.

Ah ok, cheers, thanks for the help.
I'll give that a go tomorrow night and hopefully it work.
Thanks for the help.

Kind regards,
Wayne

Sent from Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________

Hi Wayne Shephard,    We have received your feedback. Are you currently using SIMSONN Manager version 2.0.9? Also, does the software prompt any firmware updates? Please ensure you are using the latest version.  Regarding iRacing telemetry support — the game itself does not provide native ABS and TC telemetry data. SIMHUB calculates these values based on other parameters. In contrast, games like ACC offer direct telemetry data for ABS and TC.  As for the vibration stop function, this issue should have been resolved in the latest version. We've adopted a mechanism similar to SIMHUB, where a stop command is sent at regular intervals after 5 seconds of inactivity to prevent unexpected vibration due to USB instability or missed stop signals.  I will also send you a list of telemetry-supported games in version 2.0.9 for your reference.
